title: How to Make Apple and Nutmeg Muffins

steps.headline: Soak the dried fruit in the tea.
Sieve the flour to add air in a separate bowl.
steps.description: The sieved flour will make the muffins nice and light.

steps.headline: Rub in butter or margarine to the flour until it resembles a breadcrumb mixture.
Make a well in the centre of the mixture and add the sugar, eggs and milk.
Mix together well and add a generous pinch of nutmeg.
Mix again and add the apple and dried fruit soaked in tea.
Transfer the mixture into individual muffins holders.
Put directly in the oven on the 2nd shelf for 25 minutes.
Take the tray out and leave to cool with a tea towel over the top for about 20 minutes.
Remove the muffins out of the tray and place on a wire rack.
Add toppings to your liking (optional).
steps.description: Icing is lovely with custard, cream, ice-cream or toffee sauce. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 150°C.  Soak the dried fruit in the tea.  Sieve the flour to add air in a separate bowl. The sieved flour will make the muffins nice and light. Rub in butter or margarine to the flour until it resembles a breadcrumb mixture.  Make a well in the centre of the mixture and add the sugar, eggs and milk.  Mix together well and add a generous pinch of nutmeg.  Mix again and add the apple and dried fruit soaked in tea.  Mix until well combined together.  Transfer the mixture into individual muffins holders.  Put directly in the oven on the 2nd shelf for 25 minutes.  Take the tray out and leave to cool with a tea towel over the top for about 20 minutes.  Remove the muffins out of the tray and place on a wire rack.  Add toppings to your liking (optional). Icing is lovely with custard, cream, ice-cream or toffee sauce. Enjoy!
